dismissalText.commentary: Milinda Siriwardana c Sharma b Bumrah 58 (58b 2x4 1x6) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: and gone! 111 kph, slower delivery on off. Siriwardana looks to go straight but the ball skews off the outside half and lobs to cover. An easy catch. But that was a terrific knock, the best of the series for Sri Lanka.

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, gone underneath the bat this time. Full and straight, Kapugedara can't do much. Gets his hands down too late and the ball sneaks under the bat.

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! 125 kph, the fourth offcutter of the over. Slow down leg, Dickwella backs away and is flummoxed into playing early (despite it being the fourth straight slower ball). He does and chips a catch to Dhawan at midwicket who leaps up and to his left. That's another start Dickwella has thrown away

headshotImage.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: a juggle from Dhoni but Gunathilaka is so far out of his crease that Dhoni stays calm, catches the juggle and takes off the bails. Plenty of flight on that from Chahal, may have got some drift too. But Gunathilaka uses his feet as soon as he sees some flight. Misses the line due to that drift, yorks himself and Dhoni makes a tough stumping look tough. Got the job done ably

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: opts for the review after being ruled lbw. It wasn't an immediate decision, so there might not be bat involved. Doesn't seem to be on replay as Mendis plays a sweep to a good length ball on middle. "No bat," says the third umpire. Three reds and umpire Martinesz decision stands. Mendis does play this shot very well, but this time, he chooses to do so against a straight and quick delivery. And bringing the bat down across the line off a high backlift takes time. Far too much time on this occasion, certainly

headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Kohli b Pandya 9 (7b 2x4 0x6) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: another one! Sri Lanka falling away. Good length outside off, Tharanga fishes at it, gets a thick outside edge and flies straight to a wide slip. That's terrific bowling. The old 1-2, the full, wide ball after the short one, gets just enough lateral movement too, the ball shaping away. Tharanga wafts and pays the price for a flirty, nothing stroke. Good captaincy from Kohli too, to have himself there.

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews lbw b Patel 20 (41b 2x4 0x6) SR: 48.78

dismissalComment.html: appeal for lbw and Reiffel gives it. Axar strikes, and it's the big one too as Mathews walks back, the second Sri Lankan out sweeping. He plants his front leg across and tries to smack the good length ball on off stump away. But it's just that tiny bit too quick. The umpire took his time, wondering if the impact was in line with off stump, and then said yes. HawkEye show it would have been umpire's call...

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma lbw b Dananjaya 54 (45b 5x4 3x6) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: gone! Looked like the legbreak again, flat and full on leg, Rohit chooses to sweep but misses it. Dhawan seemed to instructed him, if you ... Rohit absorbs what Dhawan tells him and chooses to review. No bat on that. That is another terrible review, pitches on middle and leg, hits the stumps halfway up. Three reds and Rohit throws a hundred away.

headshotImage.caption: B Kumar headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: B Kumar headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar not out 53 (80b 4x4 1x6) SR: 66.25

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

headshotImage.caption: RG Sharma headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RG Sharma headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone! Looked like the legbreak again, flat and full on leg, Rohit chooses to sweep but misses it. Dhawan seemed to instructed him, if you ... Rohit absorbs what Dhawan tells him and chooses to review. No bat on that. That is another terrible review, pitches on middle and leg, hits the stumps halfway up. Three reds and Rohit throws a hundred away.

headshotImage.caption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 77 kph, the googly from Dananjaya and Jadhav is castled. Completely flummoxed by the fact that an offspinner is ripping googlies - well, the direction of turn is the same. He stays back, wafts with bat well away from pad, and the ball says hello to that glaring gap and goes right through to hit middle stump. That was not a good stroke, not helped by the fact that he did not have a clue of the direction of spin

headshotImage.caption: V Kohli headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalComment.html: Kohli's gone! 4 off 2! Dananjaya spinning a web around these Indian batsmen. What's happening. Yikes. Wow. Another googly, this one is soooo full but Kohli still does not manage to get bat on that. It's full and straight, Kohli takes his pads away from the line of the ball, looking for that trademark whippy cover drive, but all that does it create a massive bat-pad gap and the stumps are disturbed again. SL in raptures.

headshotImage.caption: KL Rahul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: KL Rahul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 74 kph, Rahul this time does not read the googly. And India are in trouble. Sensational control of the googly, so good that the length is just terrific - it's full but not full enough that Rahul can smother the turn, it's not short, definitely not short enough for Rahul to go back. It spins back in prodigiously, clips the pad and knocks into the stumps. 5 wickets in 15 balls. Aaaah, wow.

headshotImage.caption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: five for Dananjaya. And India are in utter shambles. It was Ajantha Mendis in Galle! It's Dananjaya in Pallekele! The power of wristpin. It's surprise, surprise, another googly. Pandya runs down to the pitch, but does not get there. Hey, guess what that does? It creates yet another bat-pad gap. The snake of a googly finds that gap, and settles nicely in Dickwella's gloves. Pandya was not reading that, thought he could smother the spin but the bowler was clever enough to drag that length back.

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: 86 kph, the non-turning offbreak? Who cares, say Sri Lanka. Axar can't review even if he wants to. Yes, it is. The non-turning offbreak on off, flat and full, draws Axar forward, beats the bat on the inside edge and strikes him in front of off. Sri Lanka have formed a circle with enough energy to power those floodlights that failed in the CPL earlier today. Akila has six!

headshotImage.caption: Milinda Siriwardana player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Milinda Siriwardana player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: S Dhawan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: S Dhawan headshot

dismissalComment.html: what a catch! That was perfect timing, sprinted right from the outset, ran to the ball in a straight line - as opposed to around the ball - and took the catch inches off the ground. Stunning catch. Flat down leg from Siriwardana, would have been wide had Dhawan chosen not to sweep. His top-edged lobbed towards short fine leg. That's the best moment of the ODI series for Sri Lanka

commentTextItems.html: and that's the game. Short down leg and the game is finished with a wide. India take a 2-0 lead in the series. That's a terrific rearguard effort after falling to 131 for 7. Dhoni again, and Bhuvneshwar, comfortably taking them through in the end.

commentPostTextItems.html: 11.37pm India were stuttering and stumbling, faltering at 131 for 7 when Dhoni and Bhuvneshwar soaked up all the pressure from Sri Lanka and Akila Dananjaya, who led his team to that position with six wickets. From then on, it was a cruise as India coasted to a three-wicket win with time to spare. Sri Lanka finally found some quality and class but that was still not enough. What will be? They'll need some answers, but India keep finding ways to win, despite being in tough situations.
Presentation time. This could be interesting.
Akila Dananjaya is the Man of the Match: "The offspin was working, so continuously used the variations. I came back to the hotel at around 11PM last evening."

Upul Tharanga: "Disappointed, we came really close. We didn't capitalise again. They had a good start. Once they needed 100 runs, we tried everything. We just couldn't get the breakthrough. Our bowling and fielding has improved."

Virat Kohli: "Quite an exciting game of cricket, fans and players entertained. Good to come through eventually. Two 100-run partnerships in a chase of 230 with seven wickets, that's quite bizarre. When you're 110 for 1, in a chase of 230, you want to give everyone a chance to bat. We don't have any regrets. If i had gone at No. 3, I would have still missed that ball because he was bowling that well. We thought he was the offspinner with a good legbreak, but he got four wickets off googlies. We'll be more careful next time. Credit to him for pitching the ball in the right areas."

commentTextItems.html: 136 kph, short on off, guided to third man. India can't lose this one. Fine effort

commentPreTextItems.html: SL can do with a hat-trick

commentTextItems.html: 134 kph, short and wide, angled across, Bhuvneshwar does not get bat on that. Dhoni has a chat with Bhuvi
gets right to the pitch, nudged through square leg in typical bunty fashion for two more. Superb spell from Dananjaya

commentTextItems.html: short and wide, crashed to mid-off. "No, no" he says
flat and straight, flicked to square leg for one
tossed up outside off, driven to deep cover for a couple to get to fifty. Sensational innings from Bhuvneshwar this
the legbreak outside off, carved to deep point. Refuses the second

commentPreTextItems.html: Animesh: "Only 12 times in ODI history has a bowler taken 6 wickets and still ended up on the losing side. It has happened twice in 2017, both times involving non test playing nations."

commentTextItems.html: short outside off, hit to cover
back of a length outside off, guided away to the sweeper cover.

commentPreTextItems.html: Ishan Jain: "Malinga has taken 7 wickets in 10 innings since his comeback. He doesn't look threatening at all, not even in T20's. He needs to redefine his bowling, otherwise he will lose his place soon."

commentTextItems.html: good length outside off, a thick inside edge towards midwicket. Chippin' away
full outside off, another nice punchy drive to cover. Moves to 48
a short short delivery on off, way over head and gives India one more free run
full and wide, punched to the sweeper cover. All too easy currently
four more. Looking for the yorker, drifts down leg and Bhuvneshwar tickles that fine, gets four to fine leg. Is this game done now? Bhuvi on 47

dismissalText.commentary: Niroshan Dickwella c Dhawan b Bumrah 31 (24b 3x4 2x6) SR: 129.16

dismissalComment.html: gone! 125 kph, the fourth offcutter of the over. Slow down leg, Dickwella backs away and is flummoxed into playing early (despite it being the fourth straight slower ball). He does and chips a catch to Dhawan at midwicket who leaps up and to his left. That's another start Dickwella has thrown away

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka st †Dhoni b Chahal 19 (37b 2x4 0x6) SR: 51.35

dismissalComment.html: a juggle from Dhoni but Gunathilaka is so far out of his crease that Dhoni stays calm, catches the juggle and takes off the bails. Plenty of flight on that from Chahal, may have got some drift too. But Gunathilaka uses his feet as soon as he sees some flight. Misses the line due to that drift, yorks himself and Dhoni makes a tough stumping look tough. Got the job done ably

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis lbw b Chahal 19 (48b 2x4 0x6) SR: 39.58

dismissalComment.html: opts for the review after being ruled lbw. It wasn't an immediate decision, so there might not be bat involved. Doesn't seem to be on replay as Mendis plays a sweep to a good length ball on middle. "No bat," says the third umpire. Three reds and umpire Martinesz decision stands. Mendis does play this shot very well, but this time, he chooses to do so against a straight and quick delivery. And bringing the bat down across the line off a high backlift takes time. Far too much time on this occasion, certainly

headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Kohli b Pandya 9 (7b 2x4 0x6) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: another one! Sri Lanka falling away. Good length outside off, Tharanga fishes at it, gets a thick outside edge and flies straight to a wide slip. That's terrific bowling. The old 1-2, the full, wide ball after the short one, gets just enough lateral movement too, the ball shaping away. Tharanga wafts and pays the price for a flirty, nothing stroke. Good captaincy from Kohli too, to have himself there.

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews lbw b Patel 20 (41b 2x4 0x6) SR: 48.78

dismissalComment.html: appeal for lbw and Reiffel gives it. Axar strikes, and it's the big one too as Mathews walks back, the second Sri Lankan out sweeping. He plants his front leg across and tries to smack the good length ball on off stump away. But it's just that tiny bit too quick. The umpire took his time, wondering if the impact was in line with off stump, and then said yes. HawkEye show it would have been umpire's call...

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma lbw b Dananjaya 54 (45b 5x4 3x6) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: gone! Looked like the legbreak again, flat and full on leg, Rohit chooses to sweep but misses it. Dhawan seemed to instructed him, if you ... Rohit absorbs what Dhawan tells him and chooses to review. No bat on that. That is another terrible review, pitches on middle and leg, hits the stumps halfway up. Three reds and Rohit throws a hundred away.

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Mathews b Siriwardana 49 (50b 6x4 1x6) SR: 98

dismissalComment.html: what a catch! That was perfect timing, sprinted right from the outset, ran to the ball in a straight line - as opposed to around the ball - and took the catch inches off the ground. Stunning catch. Flat down leg from Siriwardana, would have been wide had Dhawan chosen not to sweep. His top-edged lobbed towards short fine leg. That's the best moment of the ODI series for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul b Dananjaya 4 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: 74 kph, Rahul this time does not read the googly. And India are in trouble. Sensational control of the googly, so good that the length is just terrific - it's full but not full enough that Rahul can smother the turn, it's not short, definitely not short enough for Rahul to go back. It spins back in prodigiously, clips the pad and knocks into the stumps. 5 wickets in 15 balls. Aaaah, wow.

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

dismissalText.commentary: Kedar Jadhav b Dananjaya 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: 77 kph, the googly from Dananjaya and Jadhav is castled. Completely flummoxed by the fact that an offspinner is ripping googlies - well, the direction of turn is the same. He stays back, wafts with bat well away from pad, and the ball says hello to that glaring gap and goes right through to hit middle stump. That was not a good stroke, not helped by the fact that he did not have a clue of the direction of spin

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli b Dananjaya 4 (2b 1x4 0x6) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: Kohli's gone! 4 off 2! Dananjaya spinning a web around these Indian batsmen. What's happening. Yikes. Wow. Another googly, this one is soooo full but Kohli still does not manage to get bat on that. It's full and straight, Kohli takes his pads away from the line of the ball, looking for that trademark whippy cover drive, but all that does it create a massive bat-pad gap and the stumps are disturbed again. SL in raptures.

headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hardik Pandya st †Dickwella b Dananjaya 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: five for Dananjaya. And India are in utter shambles. It was Ajantha Mendis in Galle! It's Dananjaya in Pallekele! The power of wristpin. It's surprise, surprise, another googly. Pandya runs down to the pitch, but does not get there. Hey, guess what that does? It creates yet another bat-pad gap. The snake of a googly finds that gap, and settles nicely in Dickwella's gloves. Pandya was not reading that, thought he could smother the spin but the bowler was clever enough to drag that length back.

dismissalText.commentary: Axar Patel lbw b Dananjaya 6 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: 86 kph, the non-turning offbreak? Who cares, say Sri Lanka. Axar can't review even if he wants to. Yes, it is. The non-turning offbreak on off, flat and full, draws Axar forward, beats the bat on the inside edge and strikes him in front of off. Sri Lanka have formed a circle with enough energy to power those floodlights that failed in the CPL earlier today. Akila has six!

milestones.description: MS Dhoni and Bhuvneshwar's 100-run partnership is IND's highest for the 8th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 84 between Harbhajan and Praveen Kumar

stories.title: SL bring Chandimal, Thirimanne in place of Gunathilaka, Tharanga
stories.subTitle: India in Sri Lanka 2017
stories.seoTitle: SL bring Dinesh Chandimal, Lahiru Thirimanne in place of Danushka Gunathilaka, Upul Tharanga
stories.summary: The two batsmen have been brought in for the remainder of the ODI series after Danushka Gunathilaka was ruled out due to a shoulder injury and Upul Tharanga was suspended for two matches

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal plays one through fine leg
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal plays one through fine leg, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Dambulla, March 25, 2017

stories.title: Realised offbreaks wouldn't help on this track - Dananjaya
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Realised offbreaks wouldn't help on this track - Dananjaya
stories.summary: Akila Dananjaya, who took 6 for 54, realised early on that the offbreak wouldn't be helpful against India in Pallekele and switched to bowling legbreaks and googlies instead

image.caption: Akila Dananjaya's wrong'uns dismantled India's batting line-up
image.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya's wrong'uns dismantled India's batting line-up, Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, August 24, 2017

stories.title: Wanted to play Dananjaya as someone who bowls googlies - Bhuvneshwar
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Wanted to play Akila Dananjaya as someone who bowls googlies - Bhuvneshwar Kumar
stories.summary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar revealed that he was especially mindful of Dananjaya's incoming delivery and walked in with a plan to counter it, after hauling India to an improbable win in the second ODI

image.caption: Bhuvneshwar Kumar posted his maiden ODI half-century and lead India's chase
image.longCaption: Bhuvneshwar Kumar posted his maiden ODI half-century and lead India's chase, Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, August 24, 2017

stories.title: India's record eighth-wicket stand, and Dananjaya's dream spell
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Stats - India's record eighth-wicket stand, and Dananjaya's dream spell
stories.summary: The Sri Lanka spinner's figures of 6 for 54 were his country's best in a losing cause in ODIs

image.caption: MS Dhoni inspects bats during training session
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni inspects bats during training session, Pallekele, August 22, 2017

stories.title: Dhoni, Bhuvneshwar trump Dananjaya's 6 for 54
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: MS Dhoni, Bhuvneshwar Kumar trump Akila Dananjaya's 6 for 54
stories.summary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar and MS Dhoni added an unbroken 100, an Indian record for the eighth wicket, to turn the tables on Sri Lanka and lead India to a three-wicket win

image.caption: Bhuvneshwar Kumar posted his maiden ODI half-century and lead India's chase
image.longCaption: Bhuvneshwar Kumar posted his maiden ODI half-century and lead India's chase, Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, August 24, 2017

stories.title: Pothas 'very happy' with 'hugely supportive' SLC
stories.subTitle: India in Sri Lanka 2017
stories.seoTitle: Nic Pothas 'very happy' with 'hugely supportive' SLC
stories.summary: The interim coach was earlier critical of fickle selections following the nine-wicket loss in Dambulla, but has now struck an optimistic note about the team's prospects

image.caption: Nic Pothas and Lasith Malinga have a chat
image.longCaption: Nic Pothas and Lasith Malinga have a chat, Dambulla, August 19, 2017

stories.title: Onus on youngsters to lift Sri Lanka out of the pits
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v India, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Onus on youngsters to lift Sri Lanka out of the pits
stories.summary: India would not have expected their successes to come quite as easily as they have so far on this tour. There's little to suggest the trend will be bucked in Pallekele
